name: Granulomatous Polyangiitis with Eosinophilic Predominance (GPE)
chief_complaint: I've had this terrible cough for weeks, and now my joints are swollen and painful. I also feel like I can't catch my breath sometimes.
treatment: Rituximab or cyclophosphamide for remission induction
prognosis: Guarded. While treatment can induce remission, relapses are common (60% within 5 years). Pulmonary involvement carries higher mortality risk.
description: A rare variant of ANCA-associated vasculitis characterized by necrotizing granulomatous inflammation with striking eosinophilic infiltration affecting small-to-medium vessels. Distinct from eosinophilic granulomatosis with polyangiitis by its p-ANCA positivity and unique histopathology showing 'eosinophilic microabscesses' within granulomas.
risk_factors: History of allergic rhinitis or asthma
